revised_title: Palaeocoryne: A New Genus of Tubularine Hydrozoa in the Carboniferous Formation
tldr: The authors describe a new genus, Paleocoryne, containing two species of Tubularine Hydrozoa found in the Carboniferous formation. They determine the species to be parasitic on Fenestellae and discuss their relation to other fossil organisms like Graptolites and medusoids.
